sen.j: 伝香寺（でんこうじ）は奈良県奈良市小川町にある律宗の寺院。
sen.e: Denko-ji Temple is a temple of Ritsu sect located in Ogawa cho, Nara City, Nara Prefecture.
Denko-ji Temple is a temple belonging to the Ritsu sect, located in Ogawa cho, Nara City, Nara Prefecture.
Denko-ji Temple is a temple belonging to the Ritsu sect, located in Ogawa cho, Nara City, Nara Prefecture.

sen.j: 山号はなし。
sen.e: It does not have any honorific mountain prefix.
It does not have a sango (literally "mountain name", a title prefixed to the name of a Buddhist temple).
It does not have a sango (literally "mountain name", a title prefixed to the name of a Buddhist temple).

sen.j: 本尊は釈迦如来（千手観音とする資料もある）。
sen.e: The principal image is Shaka Nyorai (Shakyamuni) (Senju Kannon [Thousand Armed Avalokiteshwara] in some materials).
The principal image is Shaka Nyorai (Shakyamuni), although it contains the Senju Kannon (Thousand Armed Avalokiteshwara).
The principal image is Shaka Nyorai (Shakyamuni), although it contains the Senju Kannon (Thousand Armed Avalokiteshwara).

sen.j: 花びらが一枚ずつ散ってゆく散り椿は、東大寺開山堂の糊こぼし・白毫寺の五色椿と並び「奈良三名椿」に数えられる。
sen.e: Chiri-tsubaki, camellia with petals falling one by one, is one of "Three-famed camellia in Nara", along with Nori-koboshi, camellia with spots look like dropped glue in Kaisando of Todai-ji Temple and Goshiki-tsubaki, five-colored camellia in Byakugo-ji Temple.

Chiri-tsubaki, a variety of camellia named for its characteristic of shedding petals one by one, is one of the "Three-famous camellia of Nara", along with nori-koboshi, a kind of camellia with spots which look like glue, found at the Kaisando Hall at Todai-ji Temple, and goshiki-tsubaki, the five-colored camellia of Byakugo-ji Temple.

Chiri-tsubaki, a variety of camellia named for its characteristic of shedding petals one by one, is one of the "Three-famous camellia of Nara", along with nori-koboshi, a kind of camellia with spots which look like glue, found at the Kaisando Hall at Todai-ji Temple, and goshiki-tsubaki, the five-colored camellia of Byakugo-ji Temple.

sen.j: 鑑真和上の弟子である思託（したく）律師により宝亀2年（771年）に開創されたと伝わるが、創建の正確な時期・事情は定かでなく、以後中世までの沿革も定かでない。
sen.e: This temple is said to be founded in 771 by Shitaku Risshi, the disciple of Ganjin Wajo, but the exact time/circumstances of the foundation, as well as subsequent history until the medieval period are not clear.

This temple is said to have been founded in 771 by Shitaku Risshi, the disciple of Ganjin Wajo, but the exact time and circumstances of its foundation, as well as its subsequent history until medieval times remain unclear.

This temple is said to have been founded in 771 by Shitaku Risshi, the disciple of Ganjin Wajo, but the exact time and circumstances of its foundation, as well as its subsequent history until medieval times remain unclear.

sen.j: 天正13年（1585年）に武将の筒井順慶の母・芳秀宗英尼が順慶の菩提を弔うために再興した。
sen.e: In 1585, the mother of a busho, Junkei TSUTSUI, 芳秀宗英尼 rebuilt it to pray to Buddha for the happiness of dead Junkei.
sen.cmt: 「芳秀宗英尼」の定訳，読みを確認できませんでした。
sen.e: In 1585, the mother of military commander Junkei TSUTSUI, 芳秀宗英尼, rebuilt it to pray to Buddha for the happiness of Junkei after his death.
In 1585, the mother of military commander Junkei TSUTSUI, Hoshun Soei-ni Nun, rebuilt it to pray to Buddha for the happiness of Junkei after his death.
sen.cmt: 伝香寺が経営する伝香寺学園のいさがわ幼稚園のwebページhttp://www.isagawa.ed.jp/denkoji/index.htmlによると、筒井順慶の母は芳秀尼（ほうしゅんに）と称されるようです。芳秀宗英尼の宗英は「Soei」と読まれると考えられますが、決定できません。参考の読み方としてあげました。

sen.j: 現存する本堂はその時のものである。
sen.e: The existing main hall is the rebuilt one.
This rebuilt hall remains today.
This rebuilt hall remains today.

sen.j: 本堂（重要文化財）－天正13年（1585年）の再興時に建立された寄棟造・方三間の建物で、地蔵菩薩立像が安置されている。
sen.e: Main hall (Important Cultural Property) - a building with hipped roof/three squared mats erected at restoration in 1585, in which the standing statue of Jizo Bosatsu is enshrined.

The main hall (an Important Cultural Property) is a building with a hipped roof and a design element called hosangen which was erected during the restoration of 1585, in which the statue of Jizo Bosatsu is enshrined.
sen.cmt: Grammar, style, punctuation, added for clarity, word choice.
sen.e: The main hall (an Important Cultural Property) is a building with a hipped roof and a design element called hosangen which was erected during the restoration of 1585, in which the statue of Jizo Bosatsu is enshrined.

sen.j: 表門（奈良県指定文化財）
sen.e: Front gate (Cultural Property Designated by Nara Prefecture)
The front gate is a Cultural Property designated by Nara Prefecture.
The front gate is a Cultural Property designated by Nara Prefecture.

sen.j: 重要文化財
sen.e: Important Cultural Properties
Important Cultural Properties
Important Cultural Properties

sen.j: 本堂
sen.e: Main hall
Main hall
Main hall

sen.j: 木造地蔵菩薩立像 － 鎌倉時代に一部に流行した裸形像で、別名・裸地蔵とも呼ばれ、裸形の木像の上に、普段は本物の着物が着せられている。
sen.e: Wooden standing statue of the bodhisattva Ksitigarbha - a naked statue which was popular among some people in the Kamakura period, and also known as naked Jizo, usually wearing real kimono on the wooden naked statue.

The wooden statue of the bodhisattva Ksitigarbha depicts a naked form and was popular among some parts of society in the Kamakura Period; also known as 'naked Jizo', it was usually seen with a kimono over the body of the statue.

The wooden statue of the bodhisattva Ksitigarbha depicts a naked form and was popular among some parts of society in the Kamakura Period; also known as 'naked Jizo', it was usually seen with a kimono over the body of the statue.

sen.j: 像内納入品のガラス瓶、小仏像等も一括して重要文化財に指定されている。
sen.e: Items within the statue such as glass bottle and small Buddhist statue have also been designated Important Cultural Properties.
Several individual items which form a part of the statue, such as a glass bottle and a small Buddhist statue, have also been designated Important Cultural Properties.
Several individual items which form a part of the statue, such as a glass bottle and a small Buddhist statue, have also been designated Important Cultural Properties.

sen.j: 納入品から安貞2年（1228年）頃の作品と推定される。
sen.e: These items are assumed to be made around 1228.
It is assumed that these items were made around 1228.
It is assumed that these items were made around 1228.

sen.j: 奈良県指定文化財
sen.e: Cultural Properties Designated by Nara Prefecture
Cultural Properties Designated by Nara Prefecture
Cultural Properties Designated by Nara Prefecture

sen.j: 木造聖徳太子（南無仏太子）立像
sen.e: Wooden standing statue of the Prince Shotoku (Namubutsu Taishi zo)
sen.cmt: 「南無仏太子」の定訳を確認できませんでした。
sen.e: The wooden statue of the Prince Shotoku (Namubutsu Taishi zo)
The wooden statue of the Prince Shotoku (Namubutsu Taishi zo)

sen.j: 伝香寺旧蔵の文化財
sen.e: Cultural Properties formerly held by Denko-ji Temple
Cultural Properties formerly held by Denko-ji Temple
Cultural Properties formerly held by Denko-ji Temple

sen.j: 木造聖観音立像 - 昭和4年（1929年）重要文化財（当時の国宝）に指定。
sen.e: Wooden standing statue of Sho-Kannon, Aryavalokitesvara - Designed Important Cultural Property (National Treasure at the time) in 1929.
The wooden statue of Sho-Kannon, Aryavalokitesvara was made a Designed Important Cultural Property (National Treasure at the time) in 1929.
The wooden statue of Sho-Kannon, Aryavalokitesvara was made a Designed Important Cultural Property (National Treasure at the time) in 1929.

sen.j: 第二次大戦後、民間の所有となり、現在は京都市・細見美術館の所蔵。
sen.e: After World War II, it became private property and is now held in Hosomi Museum in Kyoto city.
After World War II, it became private property and is now held by Hosomi Museum in Kyoto city.
After World War II, it became private property and is now held by Hosomi Museum in Kyoto city.

sen.j: 像高113cm。
sen.e: It is 113 cm tall.
It is 113 cm tall.
It is 113 cm tall.

sen.j: 平安時代中期、10世紀頃の作品。
sen.e: It is carved around the 10th century in the mid Heian period.
It was carved in around the tenth century in the mid Heian Period.
It was carved in around the tenth century in the mid Heian Period.

sen.j: JR大和路線奈良駅・近鉄奈良駅より下車、徒歩
sen.e: Walk from JR Yamatoji Line Nara Station/Kintetsu Nara Station
Walk from JR Yamatoji Line Nara Station or Kintetsu Nara Station
Walk from JR Yamatoji Line Nara Station or Kintetsu Nara Station
